intro: Hymenostegia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered hymenostegia, is a tropical shrub belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often borne on short pedicels. Its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature, containing several seeds. Hymenostegia parviflora is typically found in moist, shaded habitats in tropical regions of South America.
